jeus.servlet.valve

Class ValveBase

  • java.lang.Object
    • jeus.servlet.valve.ValveBase
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    jeus.servlet.valve.Valve

    public abstract class ValveBase
extends java.lang.Object
implements jeus.servlet.valve.Valve
    Convenience base class for implementations of the Valve interface. A subclass MUST implement an invoke() method to provide the required functionality, and MUST implement the init method to provide configuration management.

    • Constructor Summary

      • invoke

        public void invoke(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
                   javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response)
            throws java.io.IOException,
                   javax.servlet.ServletException
        The implementation-specific logic represented by this Valve. See the Valve description for the normal design patterns for this method. To make the valve works, getNext().invoke() must be called.

        This method MUST be provided by a subclass.

        Specified by:
        invoke in interface jeus.servlet.valve.Valve
        Parameters:
        request - The servlet request to be processed
        response - The servlet response to be created
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an input/output error occurs
        javax.servlet.ServletException - if a servlet error occurs

      • init

        public abstract void init()
                   throws jeus.servlet.valve.ValveException
        defines the initialization of the valve fields. This method will be called once while the web container is starting or an application is being deployed. This method must be provided by a subclass.
        Specified by:
        init in interface jeus.servlet.valve.Valve
        Throws:
        ValveException
